user_persona: A curious resident exploring neighborhood data.
user_goal: To navigate the map and select an area to view its data.

narrative_steps.title: Exploring the Map
narrative_steps.description: Maria opens the app and sees the full-screen interactive map. She notices the zoom controls and decides to get a closer look at her neighborhood.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Zoom In' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The map zooms in smoothly, centered near the top-left controls.

narrative_steps.title: Panning the View
narrative_steps.description: Maria wants to see another part of the city, so she drags the map to shift the view.
narrative_steps.action: Drag the map to the left.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The map pans accordingly, revealing new areas while maintaining zoom level.

narrative_steps.title: Selecting an Area
narrative_steps.description: Maria spots a neighborhood she’s interested in and clicks on it to learn more.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a specific neighborhood region.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The area boundary is highlighted in forest green, and a popup may appear with basic info.

requirement_tested: Allow users to select and compare multiple geographic areas
user_persona: A city planner evaluating district development.
user_goal: To compare two neighborhoods side-by-side for planning purposes.

narrative_steps.title: Adding First Area
narrative_steps.description: John selects the first neighborhood by clicking on it directly from the map.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a neighborhood polygon.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The area is selected and appears in a temporary selection tray.

narrative_steps.title: Adding Second Area
narrative_steps.description: He then clicks the 'Compare' button and chooses to add another area via the modal search.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Add Area' button, then enter a second area name in the modal and select it.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both areas now appear in separate cards under the 'Area Comparison' section.

narrative_steps.title: Removing One Area
narrative_steps.description: Realizing he made a mistake, John removes one of the areas by double-clicking its card.
narrative_steps.action: Double-click on the unwanted area card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: That area is removed from the comparison view, leaving only the correct one.

user_goal: To analyze age distribution differences between two areas.

narrative_steps.title: Navigating to Demographics Dashboard
narrative_steps.description: Sarah opens the dashboard and switches to the 'Demographics' tab to start her analysis.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Demographics' tab in the dashboard navigation.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Stacked column charts showing age distributions load for the currently selected areas.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Data Details
narrative_steps.description: She hovers over a segment of the chart to see exact numbers for that age group.
narrative_steps.action: Hover over a specific age group bar segment.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A tooltip displays the precise percentage or count for that demographic segment.

narrative_steps.title: Focusing on Specific Category
narrative_steps.description: Wanting to isolate data, Sarah clicks on a segment to filter all related charts.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a pie chart segment representing a certain education level.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All demographic charts update to reflect only data related to that education level.

user_persona: An economist reviewing regional financial health.
user_goal: To compare income trends and housing costs across districts.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Economic Trends
narrative_steps.description: Alex navigates to the 'Economic' dashboard tab to review income trends.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Economic' tab.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A multi-line graph showing median income trends over time appears.

narrative_steps.title: Examining Cost of Living
narrative_steps.description: He hovers over a point in the housing cost heatmap to get specific values.
narrative_steps.action: Hover over a cell in the housing cost heatmap.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A tooltip shows the exact housing cost median for that area.

narrative_steps.title: Analyzing Correlations
narrative_steps.description: Alex clicks on a trend line to explore how it affects other economic indicators.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a line in the median income graph.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Adjacent charts highlight relevant economic correlations linked to that income trend.

user_persona: A safety officer assessing neighborhood risk levels.
user_goal: To understand crime patterns and compare safety across regions.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Crime Charts
narrative_steps.description: Patricia goes to the 'Crime' tab to compare overall crime rates between selected areas.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Crime' tab.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Radial charts showing total, violent, and property crimes load for each selected area.

narrative_steps.title: Interacting with Chart Data
narrative_steps.description: She hovers over a slice of the chart to see detailed breakdowns of crime types.
narrative_steps.action: Hover over a slice in the radial chart.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A tooltip reveals numerical breakdowns of crime types for that area.

narrative_steps.title: Mapping Crime Density
narrative_steps.description: Patricia clicks a crime type slice to toggle its visibility on the map overlay.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a slice representing 'Violent Crimes'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The map updates to show a heatmap highlighting zones with higher violent crime density.

requirement_tested: Provide data dashboard with interactive charts
user_persona: A policy analyst customizing views for a presentation.
user_goal: To organize dashboard widgets effectively for reporting.

narrative_steps.title: Opening Widget Catalog
narrative_steps.description: Tommy wants to add a new chart to his dashboard and clicks the '+' icon.
narrative_steps.action: Click the '+' icon in the top toolbar.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A drawer opens listing available widgets like charts, tables, and maps.

narrative_steps.title: Adding a New Chart
narrative_steps.description: He selects a chart widget and places it on the grid canvas.
narrative_steps.action: Drag a chart widget from the catalog and drop it onto the dashboard.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The chart appears on the dashboard grid, ready for configuration.

narrative_steps.title: Adjusting Widget Size
narrative_steps.description: Tommy clicks the newly added chart to resize it for better fit.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the chart widget.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Resizing handles appear around the widget edges, allowing manual dimension adjustment.

user_persona: A frequent user wanting to save preferred setups.
user_goal: To save and later recall a personalized dashboard layout.

narrative_steps.title: Saving Current Layout
narrative_steps.description: Linda has arranged her dashboard perfectly and wants to save this setup.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Save Layout' button next to the '+' icon.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A modal pops up prompting Linda to enter a unique name for her layout.

narrative_steps.title: Naming and Confirming Save
narrative_steps.description: She enters a descriptive name and confirms the save operation.
narrative_steps.action: Type 'Q3 Report Layout' into the input field and click 'Save'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The layout is saved to her profile and appears in the saved layouts dropdown.

narrative_steps.title: Loading Saved Layout
narrative_steps.description: Later, Linda wants to reuse her saved layout for another report.
narrative_steps.action: Double-click on 'Q3 Report Layout' in the saved layouts dropdown.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The dashboard immediately reconfigures itself to match the saved layout arrangement.

requirement_tested: Support area selection through map clicking or search
user_persona: A busy professional needing quick access to specific locations.
user_goal: To quickly find and focus on a particular area using search.

narrative_steps.title: Initiating Search
narrative_steps.description: Raj remembers the name of a neighborhood but doesn’t know where it is on the map.
narrative_steps.action: Begin typing the neighborhood name into the search bar at the top center.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A dynamic list of matching suggestions appears below the search box.

narrative_steps.title: Selecting Suggested Area
narrative_steps.description: He sees the correct location in the suggestions and clicks it.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the suggested area name from the dropdown.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The map centers on that area and highlights its boundary in forest green.

user_persona: A real estate agent comparing properties in different zones.
user_goal: To evaluate comparable metrics for potential clients.

narrative_steps.title: Initiating Side-by-Side View
narrative_steps.description: Emily selects two neighborhoods and opts to compare them side-by-side.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Compare Areas' option after selecting two regions.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A split-screen view loads with each area occupying a dedicated column.

narrative_steps.title: Synchronized Scrolling
narrative_steps.description: While reviewing, Emily scrolls down one column to see more data.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll vertically within one area column.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All columns scroll together to keep content aligned horizontally.

narrative_steps.title: Focusing on Specific Area
narrative_steps.description: Emily clicks inside one column to emphasize that area’s data in shared charts.
narrative_steps.action: Click anywhere inside the right-hand area column.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Shared charts update to highlight data specifically for that selected area.

requirement_tested: Include data filtering and sorting capabilities
user_persona: A journalist preparing a story on urban inequality.
user_goal: To filter and sort data to support evidence-based claims.

narrative_steps.title: Opening Filter Panel
narrative_steps.description: David needs to narrow down the data by income thresholds and opens the filter panel.
narrative_steps.action: Click the filter icon located in the top-left corner.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A sliding panel appears from the left with filtering options and sort controls.

narrative_steps.title: Applying Filters
narrative_steps.description: He checks several income range boxes to apply immediate filters to the dashboard.
narrative_steps.action: Check the 'Low Income (<$30k)' and 'High Income (>$100k)' checkboxes.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All dashboard visuals instantly refresh to show only data matching those income criteria.

narrative_steps.title: Sorting Results
narrative_steps.description: David wants to reorder results by population size in descending order.
narrative_steps.action: Double-click on the 'Population' sort option.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Dashboard items re-sort to display highest-population areas first.

requirement_tested: Provide export functionality for comparison data
user_persona: A student working on a research paper.
user_goal: To download analyzed data for inclusion in academic work.

narrative_steps.title: Preparing Export
narrative_steps.description: Anna finishes analyzing her comparison data and wants to export it as a PDF.
narrative_steps.action: Click the ellipsis (...) icon in the top-right corner of the dashboard view.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A submenu opens with export format options: CSV, PDF, and PNG.

narrative_steps.title: Choosing Export Format
narrative_steps.description: She selects PDF to preserve formatting for her paper.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'PDF' option in the export submenu.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The current filtered/sorted dataset is sent to the backend service for processing.

narrative_steps.title: Receiving Download
narrative_steps.description: After a moment, Anna receives a prompt to download the generated file.
narrative_steps.action: Accept the browser download prompt.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A well-formatted PDF document containing the dashboard view downloads automatically.

requirement_tested: Show area boundary overlays on the map
user_goal: To identify and distinguish selected neighborhoods visually.

narrative_steps.title: Selecting an Area Boundary
narrative_steps.description: Jamie clicks on a district to learn more about it.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a neighborhood polygon on the map.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The area boundary turns bold forest green with a slight inner shading.

narrative_steps.title: Observing Hover Effects
narrative_steps.description: Jamie hovers over the boundary to see additional visual cues.
narrative_steps.action: Move the mouse cursor over the selected area's boundary.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The border thickens slightly and emits a soft glow effect.

narrative_steps.title: Deselecting the Area
narrative_steps.description: After viewing, Jamie deselects the area by clicking elsewhere.
narrative_steps.action: Click outside the selected area on the map.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The boundary styling reverts to its original low-opacity fill without emphasis.

requirement_tested: Display data legends and key metrics
user_persona: A policymaker interpreting complex data sets.
user_goal: To understand what colors and symbols represent in the visualizations.

narrative_steps.title: Reviewing Legend Information
narrative_steps.description: Marcus notices unfamiliar color codes on the map and checks the legend panel.
narrative_steps.action: Look at the legend panel positioned in the bottom-right corner.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Color mappings for categories like crime intensity and income brackets are clearly labeled.

narrative_steps.title: Collapsing Legend for Clarity
narrative_steps.description: To reduce clutter, Marcus collapses the legend panel temporarily.
narrative_steps.action: Click the collapse arrow on the legend panel header.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The legend panel minimizes, freeing up screen space while keeping key metrics visible.

requirement_tested: Enable user authentication and profile management
user_persona: A returning user accessing saved settings.
user_goal: To log in and retrieve previously saved dashboard layouts.

narrative_steps.title: Logging Into Account
narrative_steps.description: Nina visits the site again and needs to log in to access her saved preferences.
narrative_steps.action: Fill in email and password fields in the login form and submit.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: She is redirected to her last-used dashboard layout with her profile loaded.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Profile Menu
narrative_steps.description: Once logged in, Nina clicks her profile avatar to manage account features.
narrative_steps.action: Click the profile avatar icon in the top navigation bar.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A dropdown menu expands with links to saved layouts and a logout option.

requirement_tested: Implement responsive design for different screen sizes
user_persona: A commuter checking data on a mobile device.
user_goal: To access dashboard information seamlessly on a smartphone.

narrative_steps.title: Loading App on Mobile
narrative_steps.description: Omar opens the app on his phone while commuting.
narrative_steps.action: Open the application on a mobile browser.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: UI elements stack vertically with smaller charts optimized for touch interaction.

narrative_steps.title: Switching to Tablet Mode
narrative_steps.description: Later, Omar switches to a tablet for a broader overview.
narrative_steps.action: Resize the browser window to simulate tablet screen size.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The layout adjusts with collapsible panels and medium-sized widgets suitable for tablets.

narrative_steps.title: Using Desktop Experience
narrative_steps.description: Back at home, Omar uses his laptop for full analytical capabilities.
narrative_steps.action: Resize the browser window to desktop dimensions.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Full dashboard interactivity returns with wide-screen arrangements and advanced controls.
